poem:
A Massive Mistake

In halls of justice,  
the echo rings—  
choices silenced,  
liberty clipped.  
  
Lammy's verdict,  
a feathered gavel,  
strikes the hand  
before the voice—  
  
Where once twelve  
good folk weighed  
the sum of shadows,  
now magistrates stand,  
  
swift and singular,  
in this august gallery,  
where freedom's  
tenuous grasp falters.
